identificationModule.briefTitle: Efficacy and Safety of Lorundrostat in Subjects With Uncontrolled and Resistant Hypertension
identificationModule.officialTitle: A Randomized, Double-Blind, Placebo Controlled, Parallel Arm, Multicenter Phase 3 Study to Evaluate the Efficacy and Safety of Lorundrostat in Subjects With Uncontrolled and Resistant Hypertension

descriptionModule.briefSummary: This is a Phase 3 trial to evaluate the BP-lowering effect of lorundrostat (an aldosterone synthase inhibitor) in subjects with uncontrolled and resistant hypertension taking between 2 and 5 anti-hypertensive (AHT) medications.
descriptionModule.detailedDescription:
This study is a Phase 3 trial to evaluate the BP-lowering effect of lorundrostat (an aldosterone synthase inhibitor) in subjects with uncontrolled and resistant hypertension taking between 2 and 5 anti-hypertensive (AHT) medications, one of which must be a thiazide or thiazide-like diuretic.

The study consists of a 2-week screening period with a 2-week single-blind run-in period followed by a 12-week randomized, double-blind, placebo-controlled, parallel arm period. Following the randomized period subjects will be offered an opportunity to participate in an open-label extension (OLE) study. Any subject electing to not participate in the OLE will undergo a 2-week end of study (EoS) visit, which will occur after end of treatment (EoT), to complete their participation in the study.

armGroups.label: Dose 1
armGroups.description: 50 mg lorundrostat Dose 1 once daily (QD) for 12 weeks

armGroups.label: Dose 2
armGroups.description: 50 mg lorundrostat Dose 1 once daily (QD) for 6 weeks then 100 mg lorundrostat Dose 2 once daily (QD) for 6 weeks for subjects who meet prespecified criteria

interventions.name: lorundrostat Dose 1
interventions.description: 50 mg lorundrostat Dose 1 once daily (QD) for 12 weeks

interventions.name: lorundrostat Dose 2
interventions.description: 50 mg lorundrostat Dose 1 once daily (QD) for 6 weeks then 100 mg lorundrostat Dose 2 once daily (QD) for 6 weeks for subjects who meet prespecified criteria

primaryOutcomes.measure: Change from baseline in automated office BP (AOBP) SBP at Week 12 in subjects randomized to lorundrostat
Change from baseline in AOBP SBP at Week 12 in subjects randomized to lorundrostat Dose 1 with escalation to lorundrostat Dose 2

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Proportion of subjects with AOBP SBP <130 mmHg at Week 12 in combined lorundrostat dosages
Change from baseline in AOBP SBP at Week 12 in subjects with uncontrolled hypertension in combined lorundrostat dosages
Change from baseline in AOBP SBP at Week 12 in subjects with resistant hypertension in combined lorundrostat dosages
Change from baseline in AOBP SBP at Week 12 by obesity status in combined lorundrostat dosages
Change from baseline in AOBP SBP at Week 12 in subjects who did not reach SBP control by Week 6 on lorundrostat Dose 1 and were increased to lorundrostat Dose 2 (within-subjects analysis)

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

1. At least 18 years of age at the time of signing the informed consent form (ICF)
2. At Screening and Randomization: AOBP SBP of ≥135 and ≤180 mmHg plus AOBP DBP of ≥65 and ≤110 mmHg, or AOBP DBP of ≥90 and ≤110 mmHg
3. Taking between 2 and 5 AHT medications,
4. History of hypertension lasting at least 6 months prior to Screening
5. Body mass index (BMI) of ≥18 kg/m2 at Screening

Exclusion Criteria:

1. Women who are pregnant, plan to become pregnant, or are breastfeeding
2. Participation in a study involving any investigational device or small-molecule drug within 4 weeks or 6 months for biologic (antibody) drugs prior to the Screening Visit
3. eGFR \<45 mL/min/1.73m2 at Screening, calculated using the Chronic Kidney Disease Epidemiology Collaboration (CKD-EPI) formula
4. Serum potassium \>5.0 mmol/L at Screening or \>4.8 mmol/L at Randomization
5. Serum sodium \<135 mmol/L (corrected for hyperglycemia) at Screening.
6. History of heart failure, myocardial infarction, stroke, or transient ischemic attack within 6 months prior to the Screening Visit.
